newsitem.title: BRAZIL: Foreigners pump $357 mln in Brazil bolsas in Sept.
newsitem.headline: Foreigners pump $357 mln in Brazil bolsas in Sept.

text.p: Net foreign capital inflows to Brazilian bolsas under Annex Four rules slipped to $357 million in September from $466 million in August, Brazil's Securities and Exchange Commission (CVM) said.
The Annex Four regulates investment in Brazilian stocks, debentures and privatization bonds.
In a statement, the CVM said September capital inflows totalled $1.64 billion while outflows reached $1.28 billion for the month.
Net capital inflows reached $2.1 billion in the first nine months, it said.

Ninety one percent of investment in September was in stocks, bringing net worth to close to 24.8 billion reais ($24.6 million), with Citicorp's Citibank DTVM accounting for 21.5 percent of the total, it said.
